subtasks.description: Scan the `experiments/` directory and produce a JSON (or plain‑text) list of all experiment sub‑directories whose modification time is older than 24 hours. Save this list to `experiments/old_experiments.txt`.
subtasks.acceptance_criteria: A file `old_experiments.txt` exists containing one absolute path per line. No directory from the current day appears in the list.

subtasks.description: For each directory in `old_experiments.txt`, examine its contents. Record whether the directory contains any non‑empty files and compute a SHA‑256 hash for every file. Produce a mapping of directory → set of file‑hashes and store it in `experiments/dir_hashes.json`.
subtasks.acceptance_criteria: `dir_hashes.json` is a valid JSON object where each key is a directory path and the value is an array of file‑hash strings. Directories with only empty files have an empty array.

subtasks.description: Identify directories that are either (a) completely empty (no files or only empty files) or (b) duplicate of another directory (all file‑hash sets are identical to another directory). Create two files: `experiments/to_delete.txt` (list of directories to remove) and `experiments/to_keep.txt` (list of directories to retain).
subtasks.acceptance_criteria: `to_delete.txt` contains only paths older than 24 h and never includes a directory from today. `to_keep.txt` contains the complementary set. No duplicate directory appears in both files.

subtasks.description: Delete every directory listed in `to_delete.txt`. While deleting, sum the size of all removed files to compute total bytes freed. Write the total freed bytes to `experiments/bytes_freed.txt`.
subtasks.acceptance_criteria: All directories in `to_delete.txt` are removed from the filesystem. `bytes_freed.txt` contains a single integer representing the total number of bytes reclaimed.

subtasks.description: Generate a final report `experiments/prune_report.txt` summarizing the operation: number of directories deleted, number kept, and total bytes freed. Include a timestamp of when the prune ran.
subtasks.acceptance_criteria: `prune_report.txt` exists and contains three lines: `Deleted: X`, `Kept: Y`, `Bytes Freed: Z`. The numbers match the counts from previous steps and the bytes value matches `bytes_freed.txt`.
